reviews.review: Honestly a must play for everyone. If you like puzzle solving you need to try this game, even if you aren't a fan of the genre you should still give it a try. Portal is an iconic game everyone should have played

BAŞIM DÖNDÜ

Одна из лучших игр от VALVE.
Можно поиграть с другом.
Купить скины.
Да и вообще провести классно время.

Portal is an amazing, and engaging game for new gamers looking for a puzzle game. As someone who leans towards casual gaming, I love seeing games that are new-player friendly and full of worthwhile, engaging content. If you’re the average gamer, you either know what the 2007 Valve classic “Portal” is or have at least heard of a reference to a “companion cube,” or a “portal gun.” For those of you interested in sitting back and playing a game that’s not a $60 shoot em’ up, I encourage you to buy Portal, and be led by a snarky, sadistic robot through this post-apocalyptic lab that holds ith challenging yet incredibly satisfactory puzzles.
Unlike most popular puzzle games, Portal is a first-person platformer with a compelling plot rationed to you through environmental clues in lab levels, and contemptuous remarks from GLaDOS, the robot programmed to create puzzles. As you walk through the laboratory, creating portals to manipulate and maneuver through the levels, the stillness of the laboratory creates an uneasy atmosphere. The white, metal walls seem to close in around you, and the silence is only broken by the industrial sounds of the machines and tech throughout the facility.
A lot of games fail to effectively teach new players controls and concepts. Portal, however, is incredibly accessible. Having only a couple of controls, walking, and making portals, the other mechanics that either help or hinder introduce themselves gradually throughout the levels so when you feel you’ve finally got it down, you’ve got something new to deal with. While you become comfortable with these simple controls, Portal engages you mentally and rewards you with satisfactory solutions. Portal also doesn’t take up a lot of disk space, CPU power, or ram, allowing smooth gameplay for those without high-end computers (Portal is also available for PS3 and the Xbox 360).
Playing Portal can easily lead you to a whole new world of games and communities of people to talk to and play with. If you end up enjoying Portal, Valve has a lot of old classics like Portal with large player bases even to this day. You can go on to play games like Portal 2 (imagine Portal but on steroids), Half-life, a classic FPS, or play other games of your choice with your new background knowledge of gaming under your belt. Whether puzzle games are totally your thing or just something you tolerate, Portal is a low risk, high reward purchase that is definitely a must-try in the world of gaming.
